newsitem.title: JAPAN: China sets March Daqing at $18.88/bbl -- traders.
newsitem.headline: China sets March Daqing at $18.88/bbl -- traders.

text.p: China has calculated the price of its Daqing crude oil for March lifting to Japanese customers at $18.88 per barrel, down $2.13 from February's $21.01, traders said on Tuesday.
The Daqing price is linked to the average of Indonesia's official prices for Minas and Cinta crudes.
Japanese buyers have accepted a Chinese offer to allocate six million to eight million tonnes per year for the 1996-2000 period .
China reviews its Daqing export volume every five years.
